poem:
Title: "In the Midst of the Metropolis Maelstrom"

Affliction's shadow looms around the mayoral malaise,
Khan, standing beyond the fog of baseless fear.
In London, where history and diversity interchange,
Hatred tries to implant itself, drawing resentment near.

Yet the populace, with discerning hearts that don't sway,
Witnesses the courage in the face of the destructive smear.
Election's vortex echoes, "Some Sunaks fall, Khans stay."
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Islamophobia has warped the London mayoral race. It would be unusual, for example, to think “I can’t stand Rishi Sunak” (wait! That’s not the unusual bit)". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long.
